sentences.english: How can you expect to make progress if you don't work hard?
sentences.chinese: 你不下苦功怎麼能指望取得進步？

sentences.english: The student must make a real effort to improve his speed, and if necessary his comprehension, with each exercise.
sentences.chinese: 學生們必須在提高閱讀速度上下一番苦功。

sentences.english: Aspire to appropriate's character, reading must try hard.
sentences.chinese: 立志宜思真品格，讀書須盡苦功夫。

sentences.english: We must work hard at the spoken language .
sentences.chinese: 我們必須在口語方面下苦功夫。

sentences.english: We must work hard at a foreign language so as to master it.
sentences.chinese: 爲了掌握外語，我們必須下苦功夫。

sentences.english: It is impossible to learn a foreign language without making painstaking effort.
sentences.chinese: 想不下苦功就能學會外語是不可能的。

sentences.english: She is not very clever but she is painstaking.
sentences.chinese: 她並不很聰明，但肯下苦功夫。

sentences.english: You must try hard to improvement your command of English.
sentences.chinese: 你必須下苦功努力提高對英語的運用能力。

sentences.english: She took great pains with her English lessons and got high marks.
sentences.chinese: 她下苦功學習英語，獲得了高分。

sentences.english: His painstaking to attain his goal in life is praiseworthy .
sentences.chinese: 他爲實現人生目標所下的苦功是值得稱讚的。

sentences.english: After all, life lessons are always learned the hard way.
sentences.chinese: 畢竟，生活中的教訓總是需費一番苦功才能學到。

sentences.english: POETRY】The teacher praised her great efforts at poetry.
sentences.chinese: 老師稱讚她肯下苦功作詩。

sentences.english: The mastery of a foreign language is difficult and requires painstaking effort.
sentences.chinese: 要學好一門外語是不容易的，非下苦功不可。

sentences.english: Mary took great pains with her English lesson and got high marks.
sentences.chinese: 瑪麗下苦功學習英語並取得高分。

sentences.english: Determined to think of the true character, reading must do the hard work.
sentences.chinese: 立志宜思真品格，讀書須盡苦功夫。

sentences.english: He owed his success to luck more than to hard work.
sentences.chinese: 他取得的成功靠好運多於靠下苦功。

definition: to make painstaking efforts (idiom); after much trouble/to work hard at sth
period of time (may be months, or mere seconds)/spare time/skill/labor/effort
to train hard/to practice diligently/hard work/blood, sweat, and tears
to put in time and energy/to concentrate one's efforts
level of mastery (of a skill or area of knowledge)/(archaic) to pay a visit to sb
painstaking effort/to take a lot of trouble/laborious at pains
